full_summary:
=====================================

**Tender Announcement:**

The Department of National Defence is soliciting proposals for the provision of senior-level Life Cycle Management Specialists (LCMS) for the support services of auxiliary equipment and systems.

**Contract Details:**

* Contract Number: W8482-231431/B
* Amendment Number: 3
* Solicitation Number: W8482-231431/B
* Publication Date: 2024-01-23
* Tender Closing Date: 2024-02-14T14:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: April 1, 2024
* Expected Contract End Date: March 31, 2027

**Overview:**

This tender is to provide two (2) 5.16 Life Cycle Management Specialist (LCMS) - Senior resources to support the Directorate of Maritime Equipment Program Management Major Surface Combatant. The Contractor must provide technical expertise to update, maintain, and manage His Majesty's Canadian (HMC) Ships' and Submarines' Auxiliary Equipment and Systems for all Class vessels.

**Services Required:**

* LCMS 1: Black and Gray Water Collection, Treatment, and Distribution Systems
* LCMS 2: Freshwater Production, Treatment, and Distribution Equipment and Systems
* Project Management, Technical Investigation, and Engineering Support

**Trade Agreements:**

The following trade agreements are applicable to this tender:

* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP)
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement

**Security Requirements:**

* Company Minimum Security Level Required: SECRET
* Resource Minimum Security Level Required: SECRET
* Document Safeguarding Security Level Required: None

**Document Request:**

The Request for Proposal (RFP) documents will be emailed directly to the qualified Supply Arrangement Holders. The documents are not available on the Government Electronic Tendering System.
